group_1.narration: <Once, there was a villain in Kamihama.>
<The villain used suggestion magic@to control many people…even Witches.@She spread misfortune and calamity,@while cackling with laughter.>
<Her name…was Hanna Sarasa.@She was a Magical Girl…>
<Many girls had their threads of fates tugged@by either her or the Witches in her control,@such as Nanaka Tokiwa, a fellow Magical Girl.>

<For many generations, the Tokiwa family had been@the head family of Kashin-ryu, but when their pupils@received a Witch's Kiss, the family lost everything.@Nanaka alone was left bear the burden of her fate…>

<Even so…Nanaka sought the truth.@She made a pact with other girls who were victim@to the same Witch, such as Kako Natsume,@a girl whose family's second-hand bookstore,@which they operated out of their home, had fallen@to arson by someone controlled by that very Witch.>
<All of it was to fulfill Nanaka's fated vengeance.>
<The trio who grew up in the Azalea House@were also the playthings of incidents@seemingly created to make a mockery of them.@And even so, they continued to seek clues…>
<The girls investigated an occurrence at@the Daito housing complex, closing in on Hanna,@the perpetrator at the heart of all these events.>
<Their fates were intricately interwoven,@and countless obstacles stood in their way.@Ultimately, however, the girls were able to join@hands and overcome what stood against them.>
<And then the whole affair came to an abrupt end…@When Hanna shattered her own Soul Gem.>
<Everyone assumed that Hanna was@a lone operator, the sole perpetrator@who spread misfortune with glee…@But in truth, she was not alone.>
<There was also a Magical Girl@by Hanna's side named Mikoto Sena,@who colluded with her to ruin everything.>

<...Though Mikoto had already lost her body@by becoming a Witch, and now dwelled within@Hanna's consciousness, she had been influenced@by her Witch's desire to destroy Kamihama.@And so she worked with Hanna@to bring everything in it to an end.>
<But what Hanna truly wanted was to destroy@all that Mikoto hated, the things that were@binding her, so that Mikoto would no longer@be trapped by the will of destruction.>
<Thus, by becoming a great evil and meeting@her own death, Hanna hoped to teach Mikoto that@if she let herself be consumed by her hatred and@despair and fell to evil, she would only face defeat.>
<And that is why in the end, Hanna lit@a beacon of hope in Kamihama, like a prayer,@so that Mikoto could be reborn and live.>

<Mikoto, however, could not accept@that beacon, and instead committed herself@to a mission to destroy the entire world…@But that came to an end, and all of it was swept@into the past, remaining only in memory…>
"But even so, Hanna, you're the only one@who was always able to find me…@So I'm going to keep chasing after you."
"No matter what stands in my way again…"
